channel.title: Site avatars for everyone
channel.description:
I already posted this on the site discussions/suggestions board, however that board is extremely dead and it's not likely to get noticed for a long time, by the time someone makes an argument about it I will have forgotten about it so I'll paste the post here:
I think all members of the forum should have access to using an offsite image link for an avatar. Avatars are a good way for people to express themselves, show others their interests and what they like, ect. It wouldn't eat too much bandwith either if you have it with offsite image links. I don't really see any reason for avatars to be a mod/admin only thing and I've never understood why they've been disabled here for so long.

item.title: Site avatars for everyone
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Tom_BETA:

Everyone can use their signature, you can post URLs or just write text. My current avatar is from a TV show called Lost, if I didn’t have access to an avatar I could easily put Lost in my signature, or a link to the image.

Except that an avatar will immediately grab the attention of someone browsing the forum.

Thabest:

I don’t see why you should have to earn the right to have a little icon to express yourself though?

As far as I know, avatars (and custom titles) are meant to be rewards for normal members who contribute to any of the two sites. IIRC, xEnt got his “RSC Guru” custom title for doing so.

If you look around at a few forums, you will surely see a few avatars with NSFW content. It gets annoying if you see them all the time.

Read full topic

item.title: Site avatars for everyone
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Thabest:

As for earning it, maybe make it available after a certain number of posts/rep?

If it was available for a certain number of posts/rep people would just spam the forums with unwanted crap. Also, reputation is massively abused on Moparscape so it would only mean something if it was on Moparisthebest.

And I don’t think the inhabitants of Moparisthebest will gladly welcome hundreds of avatar hunters. So more trouble will be made.

Thabest:

all members of the forum should have access to using an offsite image link for an avatar. Avatars are a good way for people to express themselves, show others their interests and what they like

Everyone can use their signature, you can post URLs or just write text. My current avatar is from a TV show called Lost, if I didn’t have access to an avatar I could easily put Lost in my signature, or a link to the image.

item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Well for one, you simply can’t trust everyone to use appropriate images. The implication of this is the necessity for staff to police avatars. Many forums have signature rules which aren’t followed, and moderators need to modify the person’s signature.

That aside though, the main reason that Moparisthebest has always given for not having images in signatures and avatars is that it makes forums look sloppy and unprofessional.
